Organs/Tissues: Human lung alveolar barrier (type I/II epithelium + endothelium)
Cell Source: Primary alveolar epithelial cells (Type I/II), primary lung endothelial cells
Stromal Cells: Not by default (very thin barrier), fibroblasts can be added in endothelial channel
Circulating Immune: Yes, immune cells can flow through endothelial channel
Notable Features: Cyclic 'breathing' motion (~8% stretch), TEER measurement, multi-week ALI culture
Plate/Format (Throughput): AX12 plate (12 independent units), medium throughput, 96-well footprint size
Max Culture Duration: Up to ~3+ weeks with stable ALI
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (both sides of membrane for flow cytometry/qPCR)
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: TEER electrode system, no built-in chemical sensor
Perfused: Passive or intermittent flow in endothelial channel, not continuous
Gas Mix Controlled: Via incubator (air or custom gas over ALI side)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can adjust breathing motion/flow, add immune cells, etc.
model_availability: Both (product: AX12 system + possible support services)

Organs/Tissues: Human lung alveolar barrier with induced pathological state (inflammation, fibrotic changes)
Physiological/Pathological: Pathological – e.g. inflammatory or fibrotic alveolus
Cell Source: Same primary alveolar epithelium + endothelium, with pro-fibrotic or pro-inflammatory stimuli, optional immune cells
Stromal Cells: Fibroblasts may be included to model fibrosis
Circulating Immune: Yes (perfusing immune cells to mimic infiltration)
Notable Features: Mimics diseased lung environment (e.g. TGF-β-induced fibrosis, cytokine-driven inflammation), real-time TEER to track barrier disruption
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: TEER electrodes; no O2 sensor integrated
Perfused: Intermittent or partial flow via AX Exchanger
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator-based or user-defined for ALI side
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes (adjust mechanical stretch, medium flow, immune addition)

Organs/Tissues: Human alveolar interface with integrated immune components
Physiological/Pathological: Can simulate infection or inflammation with active immune cell recruitment
Cell Source: Primary alveolar epithelial/endothelial + alveolar macrophages in apical side + circulating leukocytes in perfusion channel
Circulating Immune: Yes (introduced in endothelial flow to study transmigration)
Notable Features: Study immune-cell extravasation, alveolar inflammation, cytokine release under breathing motions
Max Culture Duration: Up to ~3 weeks, depends on immune cell viability
Perfused: Periodic or partial flow in vascular channel
Gas Mix Controlled: Incubator or custom input for ALI side
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can dynamically add immune cells, modulate stretch
